title: Designer Paul Smith: How I fell in love with a furry toy monkey
text:
Lucy Davies visits the fashion designer's workshop to meet the star of his first children’s book

Unexpected things that the designer Paul Smith has recently been sent in the post include: a wind-up robot; a parliament of papier-mâché owls and a tiny, pink origami crane that came all the way from Japan. Oh, and a rabbit. He receives at least five of those every week, after once telling an interviewer – rashly, it transpired – that he considered the rabbit to be a symbol of good luck.

A colony of them peer out from the teeming surfaces of his workroom-cum-office at Paul Smith HQ, wedged in among bicycles, cameras, books, shoes, fake moustaches, toy boats, tape measures and brass instruments....
